auth-connection.description:
Connection object that specifies the configuration for an
authentication connection that is set up for a Dev organization.

display_name.description:
Display name of the authentication connection. This name will be
visible to all the users when they sign in to this Dev
organization. For example, if the display_name is 'abclogin', then
it would appear on the login button as 'Log in to abclogin'.

enabled.description:
Whether the authentication connection is enabled or disabled. If
set to false, the authentication connection will not show up on the
login screen as a login option.

id.description: ID of the authentication connection.

auth-connection.title: auth-connection

auth-connection-options-azure-ad.description:
Object encapsulating the configuration parameters for an Azure AD
authentication connection.

client_id.description: Client ID for the Azure authentication connection.

client_secret.description: Client secret for the Azure authentication connection.

domain.description: Domain URL of the Azure authentication connection.

auth-connection-options-google-apps.description:
Object encapsulating the configuration parameters for a Google Apps
authentication connection.

tenant_domain.description: Tenant domain URL of the Google Apps authentication connection.

issuer.description: Issuer URL of the OIDC authentication connection.

Object encapsulating the configuration parameters for a SAML

signing_cert.description: Signing certificate for the SAML authentication connection.

auth-connection-options-saml.title: auth-connection-options-saml

auth-connection-type.description:
Defines the type for the authentication connection. The configuration
for each authentication connection will depend on the type value.

client_id.description:
An identifier that represents the application that requested the
token. Only applicable for application access tokens.

expires_at.description: The time at which the token expires.

issued_at.description: The time at which the token was issued.

scopes.description: The scopes associated with the issued token.

token_hint.description: A hint that identifies the token.

auth-token-grant-type.description: Specifies the process of obtaining a token.

auth-token-requested-token-type.description: The type of the requested token.

auth-token-subject-token-type.description: The type of the subject token.

auth-token-token-type.description: The type of the issued token. Bearer is the only supported token type.

auth-tokens-create-request.description:
A request to create a new token corresponding to the requested token
type.

aud.description: The expected audience values with respect to the token.

client_id.description:
An identifier that represents the application which is requesting
the token. If no client_id is present in the request to generate an
application access token (AAT), DevRev will generate a client_id.
This client_id is only associated with an AAT.

expires_in.description: The expected validity lifetime of the token in number of days.

scope.description:
The requested set of scopes associated with the issued token. A
space-delimited list of values in which the order of values does
not matter.

subject_token.description:
Represents the entity that requests the token. Not required when
requesting an application access token (AAT).

token_hint.description: A hint that identifies the token.

auth-tokens-create-request.title: auth-tokens-create-request

auth-tokens-create-response.description:
Response for the request to create a new token corresponding to the
requested token type.

access_token.description:
The issued JSON Web Token (JWT) corresponding to the requested
token type.

client_id.description:
An identifier that represents the application which is requesting
the token. Only present in a response corresponding to an
application access token (AAT).

expires_in.description:
The validity lifetime of the token specified in seconds since Unix
epoch.

refresh_token.description: A token to refresh the issued token.

scope.description:
The scopes associated with the issued token. A space-delimited list
of values in which the order of values does not matter.

auth-tokens-create-response.title: auth-tokens-create-response

auth-tokens-delete-request.description: The request to revoke the token.

token_id.description:
The unique identifier for the token under a given Dev organization.
If no token ID is provided, then the token ID will be set from the
JTI claim of the token in the authorization header.

rev_user_id.description: The unique ID of the Rev user.

user_ref.description: An identifier which uniquely identifies a Rev user.

allowed_values.description: The allowed values for the field.

reason.description: The reason the value isn't permitted.

message.description: The message associated with the error.

reference_id.description:
A unique ID that's generated for the error that can be used for

issue-priority.description: Priority of the work based upon impact and criticality.

list-mode.description:
The iteration mode to use. If "after", then entries after the provided
cursor will be returned, or if no cursor is provided, then from the
beginning. If "before", then entries before the provided cursor will be
returned, or if no cursor is provided, then from the end. Entries will
always be returned in the specified sort-by order.

org-environment.description: The environment of the Org. Defaults to 'production' if not specified.

owned_by.description: The users that own the part.

The cursor used to iterate preceding results in accordance to the
sort order. If not set, then no prior elements exist.

name.description: The updated name of the part.

Sets the owner IDs to the provided user IDs. This must not be
empty.

External ref is a unique identifier for the Rev (customer)
organization from your primary customer system of records. If none
is specified, a system-generated identifier will be assigned to the
organization.

External ref is a mutable unique identifier for a user within the
Rev organization from your primary customer record. If none is
available, a good alternative is the email address/phone number
which could uniquely identify the user. If none is specified, a
system-generated identifier will be assigned to the user.

id.description: The ID of the tag.

value.description:
The value for the object's association with the tag. If specified,
the value must be one that's specified in the tag's allowed values.

stage.description: Describes the current stage of a work item.

name.description: Current stage name of the work item.

allowed_values.description:
The allowed values for the tag, where a value is provided when a
tag is associated with an object. If empty, then no value should be
provided when the association is made.

description.description:
An informative description for the tag that should provide context
on the tag's purpose and usage.

name.description:
The name of the tag, which denotes the logical concept by which all
tagged objects will be associated. The name is guaranteed to be
unique.

tagged objects will be associated. The name is guaranteed to be
unique.

will appear in the response.

add.description:
Adds the provided artifacts to the comment. An artifact cannot be
added more than once, i.e. nothing is done if the artifact is
already attached. Mutually exclusive with `set`.

remove.description:
Removes the provided artifacts from the comment. If an artifact is
not present, then it's ignored. Mututally exclusive with `set`.

set.description: Sets the field to the provided artifacts.

timeline-entries-update-response.description: The response to updating a timeline entry.
timeline-entries-update-response.title: timeline-entries-update-response

timeline-entry-visibility.description:
The visibility of the entry. If 'private', then the entry is only
visible to the creator, otherwise if not set, then the entry has
default visibility.

display_name.description: The user's display name. The name is non-unique and mutable.
The user's display name. The name is non-unique and mutable.

event_types.description: The event types that the webhook will receive.

secret.description: The secret to use for verifying webhook events.

url.description: The URL of the webhook endpoint.

id.description: The event's ID.

timestamp.description:
Timestamp of the webhook's invocation for the event. Note this
should be used to protect against replay attacks, where the event
should only be processed if the timestamp isn't stale by several
seconds.

webhook_id.description: ID of the webhook for the event.

challenge.description:
The challenge from the "verify" request, otherwise this should not
be set for other request types.

webhook-event-type.description: The event types that the webhook will receive.

challenge.description: The challenge that must be echoed in the response.

webhooks-create-request.description: The request to create a new webhook.

event_types.description: The event types that the webhook endpoint will receive.

secret.description:
The secret to use when verifying webhook events. If provided, the
secret must be between 8 and 32 bytes (inclusive). If not set, a
secret will be automatically generated and provided in the
response.

url.description: The URL of the webhook endpoint.

webhooks-create-request.title: webhooks-create-request

webhooks-create-response.description: The response to creating a new webhook.
webhooks-create-response.title: webhooks-create-response

webhooks-delete-request.description: The request to delete a webhook.

id.description: ID for the webhook.

webhooks-delete-request.title: webhooks-delete-request

webhooks-delete-response.description: The response to deleting the webhook.
webhooks-delete-response.title: webhooks-delete-response

webhooks-get-response.description: The response to getting the information for the webhook.
webhooks-get-response.title: webhooks-get-response

webhooks-list-response.description: The response to listing the webhooks.
webhooks-list-response.title: webhooks-list-response

webhooks-update-action.description: The action to update the webhook's status.

webhooks-update-request.description: The request to update a webhook.

id.description: ID for the webhook.

secret.description:
If provided, updates the secret that's used when verifying webhook
events, which must be between 8 and 32 bytes (inclusive). Otherwise
if empty, then a new secret is generated. If the webhook is active,
then its status will transition to the 'unverified' state and it
won't receive any object events until successfully verified.

url.description:
The webhook's updated URL. If the webhook is active, then the
webhook's status will transition to the 'unverified' state and it
won't receive any object events until successfully verified.

webhooks-update-request.title: webhooks-update-request

add.description:
The event types to add. If a provided event type is already set for
the webhook, then nothing is done. Note this is mutually exclusive
with 'set'.

remove.description:
The event types to remove. If a provided event type isn't set for
the webhook, then nothing is done. Note this is mutually exclusive
with 'set'.

set.description:
The updated event types, which will replace the webhook's current
event types. Note this is mutually exclusive with 'add' and
'remove'.

webhooks-update-response.description: The response to updating the webhook.
webhooks-update-response.title: webhooks-update-response

artifacts.description: The artifacts attached to the work item.

owned_by.description: The users that own the work.

target_close_date.description: Timestamp when the work is expected to be complete.

applies_to_part.description:
The [part](https://devrev.ai/docs/product/parts) that the work
applies to. Specifying a part is required when creating tickets and
issues.

artifacts.description: The IDs of the artifacts to associate with the work item.

owned_by.description: The users that own the work.

reported_by.description: The users that reported the work.

tags.description: Tags associated with the work item.

target_close_date.description: Timestamp for when the work is expected to be complete.

sprint.description: The sprint that the issue belongs to.

group.description: The group that the ticket is associated with.

rev_org.description: The Rev organization that the ticket is associated with.

id.description: The work's ID.

works.description: The resulting collection of work items.

next_cursor.description:
The cursor used to iterate subsequent results in accordance to the
sort order. If not set, then no later elements exist.

prev_cursor.description:
The cursor used to iterate preceding results in accordance to the
sort order. If not set, then no prior elements exist.

applies_to_part.description: Updates the part that the work applies to.

body.description: Updated body of the work object, or unchanged if not provided.

id.description: The work's ID.

target_close_date.description: Updates the timestamp for when the work is expected to be complete.

title.description: Updated title of the work object, or unchanged if not provided.

set.description: Sets the IDs to the provided artifact IDs.

sprint.description: Updates the sprint that the issue belongs to.

set.description:
Sets the owner IDs to the provided user IDs. This must not be
empty.
Sets the users that reported the work to the provided user IDs.
Sets the provided tags on the work item.

group.description: The group that the ticket is associated with.

rev_org.description: Updates the Rev organization that the ticket is associated with.

auth-token.description:
All the DevRev APIs require a token to authenticate the user. Provide `Authorization: <token>` as a header to every API request.
 [How do I find my token?](https://devrev.ai/docs/apis/auth)
auth-token.name: Authorization

get.description: Gets the download URL for the artifact.

parameters.description: The ID of the artifact to get the URL for.
parameters.name: id

post.description: Creates an artifact and generates an upload URL for its data.

Creates a JWT corresponding to the requested token type for the
authenticated user.

Revokes the token that matches the given token ID issued under the
given Dev organization.

get.description:
Gets the token metadata corresponding to the given token ID under the
given Dev organization.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the token under a given Dev organization.
parameters.name: token_id

get.description:
Gets the token metadata for all the tokens corresponding to the given
token type issued for a given subject.

parameters.description:
An identifier that represents the application, which requested the
token. Only relevant for application access tokens.
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description:
The type of the requested token. If no value is specified, the
response will include tokens of all the types.
parameters.name: requested_token_type

parameters.description:
The subject associated with the token. In the absence of this
parameter, the ID of the authenticated entity is treated as the
subject.
parameters.name: subject

post.description:
Revokes all the tokens that matches the given token type created by the
authenticated user.

Updates token metadata of a token issued under a given Dev
organization.

Creates a new enterprise authentication connection for a Dev
organization. This authentication connection will not be enabled by
default for the organization and the user will need to explicitly
enable this. Keep in mind that at a time, only one authentication
connection can be enabled for a Dev organization. At present, only 5
enterprise connections can be created by an organization.

Deletes an authentication connection. Only enterprise connections which
are explicitly set up for a Dev organization can be deleted. Default
connections can not be deleted using this method.

get.description: Retrieves the details for an authentication connection.

parameters.description: ID of the authentication connection.
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Lists all the authentication connections available for a Dev
organization. This list will include both social and enterprise
connections which are either available by default or are explicitly
created by the user.

post.description:
Enable or disable an authentication connection for a Dev organization.
Currently, only 1 authentication connection can be enabled at a time.
When a new authentication connection is enabled, the connection which
is currently enabled for the Dev organization is automatically
disabled.

get.description: Lists users within your organization.

parameters.description:
The cursor to resume iteration from. If not provided, then iteration
starts from the beginning.
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: Filters Dev users based on email addresses.
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: The maximum number of Dev users to return. The default is '50'.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The iteration mode to use, otherwise if not set, then "after" is
used.
parameters.name: mode

parameters.description: Fields to sort the Dev users by and the direction to sort them.
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Filters Dev users based on state.
parameters.name: state

organization.

to access.

Creates a new tag, which is used to create associations between objects
and a logical concept denoted by the tag's name.

get.description: Lists the available tags.

starts from the beginning.

The iteration mode to use, otherwise if not set, then "after" is
used.
